page.title: 09RELIGION
page.content:
{CHURCHES}-Church of England 2, Roman Catholic 1, Methodist 3, Pentecostal 1 ST.ANNE'S (C 0f E) Chasetown, built in 1865, founded by John Robinson McClean, for mining community. First church in the country to use electricity. Built in red and blue brick. Average congre- gation 100. Three services per week. ST.JOSEPH'S (R.C.) Chasetown, built in 1883 to cater for Catholic minority in predominantly Methodist area. It has a regular congregation, average age 30. 12 services per week - 3 on Sunday.
{RELIGIOUS GROUPS} Out of 106 people surveyed the majority were C of E (67) next was Methodist(22) with R.C. (9). We found minority religions which were Spiritualist, Mormon and Jehovah's Wit- nesses. 5 claimed to be without religion.
